title: Zlatar (mountain)
text: Zlatar (, ) is a <a href="mountains%20of%20Serbia">mountain range</a> in southwestern <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>, lying between towns of <a href="Prijepolje">Prijepolje</a> and <a href="Nova%20Varo%C5%A1">Nova Varoš</a>. Its highest peak is Velika krseva, 1,627 meters tall, peak next to Golo brdo. It belongs to <a href="Stari%20Vlah">Stari Vlah</a> group of <a href="Dinaric%20Alps">Dinaric Alps</a>. Zlatar is bounded by rivers <a href="Uvac">Uvac</a>, <a href="Lim%20River">Lim</a>, <a href="Mile%C5%A1evka">Mileševka</a> and Bistrica, and has a total of four artificial lakes – <a href="Zlatar%20Lake">Zlatar Lake</a>, <a href="Radoinjsko%20Lake">Radoinjsko Lake</a>, <a href="Uvac%20Lake">Uvac Lake</a> and <a href="Potpe%C4%87">Potpeć</a>. Mountainous climate with significant <a href="mediterranean">mediterranean</a> influence, dense pine forests, and a high number of sunny days, is suitable for medicinal purposes and <a href="altitude%20training">altitude training</a>. At the elevation of 1,237 meters, there is a Special Rehabilitation Hospital "Zlatar" with 330 beds.
